description: Reported opioids deaths decreased nationally in Canada by 17 per cent last year, federal figures show, but the decreases aren't happening uniformly across the country, according to a new report.
title: Opioid deaths in Canada fell 17% in 2024, but thousands are still dying

description: Universal Ostrich has been fighting an order to kill the birds since January.
title: B.C. ostrich farm loses appeal to save birds from cull in case that attracted White House attention

description: The court-appointed monitor overseeing Hudson's Bay's creditor protection case says it's against landlords being forced to accept a B.C. billionaire's plan to buy more than two dozen of the retailer's leases.
title: Court monitor says it doesn't support Hudson's Bay plan to sell leases to Ruby Liu

description: Ontario’s nursing college has found Lindsey Coyle of Fort Frances guilty of professional misconduct, three years after she pleaded guilty in the 2015 death of an elderly patient. Coyle agreed to surrender her licence, saying she understands "the mistrust" and "shame that I've brought upon the community of nurses."
title: Losing nursing licence is 'what I deserve,' woman guilty in patient's 2015 death tells Ontario college hearing

description: When the Minnesota Vikings announced their cheerleading team roster last week, they also unleashed an online uproar as two male cheerleaders danced and shook their pom-poms with the squad.
title: Are men with pom-poms woke now? New Minnesota Vikings cheerleaders spark firestorm

description: The Crown has decided not to appeal an Ontario Superior Court justice's not guilty decisions a month ago in the sex assault trial for five former world junior hockey players.
title: Crown in Hockey Canada sex assault trial for 5 ex-players won't appeal not guilty rulings

description: "Out of an abundance of caution," health officials are recommending all children at a Brantford, Ont., daycare get treated for rabies exposure after two people handled a dead bat that tested positive for the virus.
title: Rabies treatment recommended for all children at Brantford, Ont., daycare after rabid bat found

description: A spokesperson for the family of Steffen Skjottelvik says Canadian police have notified them that the 29-year-old's backpack was recovered near the fast-moving Hayes River, where crews have focused search efforts in recent days.
title: Search crews recover backpack of Norwegian trekker missing in northern Manitoba

description: The death of Raphael Graven, 46, during a days-long broadcast in which he'd allegedly been harmed and humiliated for viewers' entertainment, has sparked mass outrage and investigation by authorities.
title: French streamers' broadcasted death prompts outcry, investigation into abuse allegations
Military member charged with terrorism warned of 'another Waco': court docs

description: A recent search of a Winnipeg-area landfill for the remains of two First Nations women murdered by a serial killer in 2022 was completed for roughly $18 million, Manitoba’s premier says — a fraction of estimates originally presented as the top end of possible costs to carry out the project.
title: Landfill search for remains of 2 First Nations women cost fraction of original estimate, Manitoba premier says

description: Canada and 21 other countries issued a joint statement on Thursday calling for the immediate halt of a recently approved Israeli settlement in the occupied West Bank.
title: Canada joins call for Israel to halt settlement plan meant to crush Palestinian statehood

description: Prime Minister Mark Carney spoke to his U.S. counterpart by phone Thursday — the first time the leaders have spoken since the two sides failed to reach a deal on a trade agreement earlier this month.
title: Carney and Trump speak for the first time since blowing past trade deal deadline

description: What started as a warm, sunny day in Brooks, Alta., on Wednesday quickly took a turn when a nasty hailstorm ripped through, crumpling and knocking over power lines and damaging cars, homes and crops.
title: Trail of destruction in Brooks, Alta., after golf ball-sized hailstorm rips through

description: New court filings show a holding company owned by David Thomson, of Thomson Reuters, wants to buy the royal charter that formed the Hudson's Bay retailer for at least $15 million and donate it to the Archives of Manitoba.
title: Billionaire David Thomson wants to buy Hudson's Bay charter, donate it to Manitoba Archives

description: Toronto police say they received a call about a shooting at Scarborough Town Centre just before 2 p.m. Thursday.
title: 1 person dead in shooting at Scarborough mall

description: Ne Zha II's incredible box office success has raised some questions. Namely: What is this whole story about? Why does it have everyone talking about China’s dethroning of Hollywood? And why is the world’s most famous face suddenly that of a pug-nosed demon baby?
title: Ne Zha II is the biggest movie in the world right now. Why is that again?

description: Edmonton police say officers have received at least 63 reports since May of people having belongings stolen while being distracted by thieves
title: String of distraction thefts across Canada prompts police warning

description: An appeals court has thrown out the massive civil fraud penalty against U.S. President Donald Trump, ruling Thursday in New York state's lawsuit accusing him of exaggerating his wealth.
title: Massive civil fraud penalty against U.S. President Donald Trump thrown out by appeals court

description: Frank Caprio, a retired municipal judge in Rhode Island who found online fame as a caring jurist and host of the courtroom show Caught in Providence, has died. He was 88.
title: Judge Frank Caprio, known online as the 'nicest judge in the world,' dead at 88

description: After more than a century without salmon in Okanagan waters, a new fish passageway means that salmon and numerous other fish species will be able to migrate upstream to spawn.
title: For the first time in over a century, sockeye salmon are able to return to Okanagan Lake

description: A Ukrainian citizen suspected to be one of the co-ordinators of the undersea explosions in 2022 that damaged the Nord Stream gas pipelines between Russia and Germany has been arrested, German prosecutors said Thursday.
title: Ukrainian man arrested in Italy over Nord Stream pipeline blasts
U.S. company has touted Mi'kmaw ownership stake in a proposed N.B. energy project. Not yet, chiefs say

description: Montreal tennis star Felix Auger-Aliassime is set to compete in his eighth straight singles main draw at the 2025 U.S. Open Tennis Championships. Despite a lengthy list of accolades, his community outreach in his father’s home country of Togo, Africa, that the tennis star wants the attention on.
title: Canadian tennis star Auger-Aliassime derives on-court success, personal growth from Togolese roots

description: The Sikh community in Mackenzie, B.C., has donated their closed Gurdwara to a community arts group, which is transforming it into a community centre.
title: In Mackenzie, B.C., a former gurdwara is finding new life as small town demographics change

description: The Icy Initiative uses photos taken by visitors to monitor glacier regression in both Jasper National Park and Glacier National Park by placing phone stands at glacier checkpoints.
title: As glaciers recede, visitors at Canada's national parks can help track their retreat

description: Here are the new Canadian novels and short story collections we can't wait to read this fall.
title: 50 Canadian fiction books we're excited about this fall

description: Residents in the Town of Brome Lake, Que., say upwards of 90 trees were cut on municipal property in front of the home of Bombardier's chairman of the board to improve his view of the lake.
title: Dozens of trees were cut on public land. Now this Quebec businessman has a view

description: A group representing seven First Nations in northern Ontario says the province’s push for a cross-Canada pipeline is moving ahead without their voices and is in conflict with federally funded conservation work already underway.
title: Ontario pipeline corridor proposal faces pushback over lack of Indigenous consultation, environmental risks

description: Big tech companies are going all-in on AI-enabled glasses. For consumers who've grown increasingly comfortable with using AI every day, they offer a convenient new contact point right before your eyes. But it's unavoidable that some personal data and privacy will be sacrificed. Will everyone want to buy in?
title: The next generation of smart glasses is getting a push from AI

description: Electoral reform advocates known as the Longest Ballot Committee helped field the largest number of candidates in Canadian history for Monday’s byelection. But politicians are starting to look at ways to crack down on such protests.
title: Was Battle River-Crowfoot the last hurrah for the long ballot protest?
